data.title: What Is Gene Hackman’s Net Worth?
data.meta_description: Gene Hackman spent decades acting in some of Hollywood's biggest hits, and he has an impressive net worth because of it.
data.text:
Few actors in Hollywood history have done it as long or as well as Gene Hackman. Just a few years after getting his start, he co-starred in the 1967 hit Bonnie and Clyde, and from there, the hits kept on coming (in a good way). After that, it didn’t take him long to establish himself as a star, and in the latter stages of his career, he had Keanu Reeves cutting his salary just to share the screen with him. Hackman spent nearly 50 years in show business before pursuing other personal passions, and he racked up an impressive net worth as an actor.

Hackman’s acting career was long and varied

Between early TV roles and the big screen, Hackman appeared in front of the camera in parts of six decades from the late 1950s to the early 2000s. And he seemingly did it all.

Per IMDb, Hackman starred in prestigious Academy Award-winning films, such as Bonnie and Clyde, The French Connection, and Unforgiven. He won Oscars for his roles in the latter two films, but he didn’t settle only for critically acclaimed movies.

Hackman’s resume includes fan favorites, such as Superman, Hoosiers, The Replacements, The Royal Tenenbaums, and alongside Denzel Washington in Crimson Tide, just to name a few. He never shied away from challenging himself or taking a role just for the sheer enjoyment of it.

Along the way, Hackman worked alongside actors including Reeves, Tom Cruise, Kevin Costner, Robin Williams, Clint Eastwood, Denzel Washington, and Warren Beatty. In addition to collaborating with some notable co-stars, Hackman racked up an impressive net worth during his time in Hollywood.

Gene Hackman’s net worth is impressive

There’s big money to be made in Hollywood. Even though Hackman is no longer acting, he spent a long time in front of the screen, and his $80 million net worth (per Celebrity Net Worth) reflects that.

Several of Hackman’s movies reached nine figures at the box office. The Firm ($270.3 million), Enemy of the State ($250.6 million), and Superman II ($190.4 million) are his three top-grossing movies, according to The Numbers.

A majority of that net worth comes from acting. Hackman has more than 100 acting credits on his resume and only one producer credit — for 2000’s Under Suspicion.

What is he doing now?

Hackman’s final role was as former President Monroe Cole in 2004’s Welcome to Mooseport. (We’re not counting the 2006 release of Superman II: The Richard Donner Cut because the theatric release happened in 1980.)
